chargeHist.descr: OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old)
OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Patty D Piersall was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 11 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Cash bail has been applied to DNA surcharge ($250), Blood draw fee ($35) and transcript fee ($6).  PAID IN FULL.  Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Muskego Police Department.  
Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant has attended Victim Impact Panel.
Case 15CF473 has been dismissed and read in.
Cash bail applied to fine ($2,277) - PAID IN FULL.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Packet of Treatment and Character Letters, received and filed in court by Atty. Williams.

Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Patty D Piersall in court with attorney Dudley A. Williams.  
Case called along with:  15CF473

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty of count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed by operation of law.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.




Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  5.5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  1.5 Years.
Extended Supervision:  4 Years.
11 Days Credit.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

4 Years D/L REVOCATION
4 Years IGNITION INTERLOCK

Fine: $2,277
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35  (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - to be forward to City of Muskego Police Department);
TRANSCRIPT FEE:  $6  (to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to District Attorney)
Apply Bail and Refund the Balance to the posting party.

Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel on:  Already Attended.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

Arraignment on December 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Patty D Piersall in court with attorney Dudley A. Williams.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Exhibit #1 marked and received. Officer Scott Sheridan from the City of Muskego Police Department, sworn and testified. Cross examination by Atty. Williams. State rests. No testimony provided by the defense. Testimony closed. State moves for bind over. Defense objects to the bind over.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
